title: Behind the scenes at the International Court of Justice
summary: Since 1947, the International Court of Justice in The Hague has issued rulings on conflicts around the world, from Israel's offensive in Gaza, Russia's invasion of Ukraine and even whether some states are more to blame for the effects of global warming.

title: A ship with 200 tonnes of aid to inaugurate a sea route from Cyprus to the Gaza strip
summary: The vessel belonging to Spain's Open Arms aid group will make a pilot voyage to test the corridor scheduled to depart on Saturday.

title: Biden proposes a tax raise on billionaires, corporations, and portrays Trump as the candidate of the rich
summary: In his State of the Union address, the US president proposed raising the corporate tax rate from 21% to 28% and called for a minimum tax.

title: December 2023 to February 2024 was the warmest US winter on record
summary: The absence of ice impacts everything from businesses that rely on outdoor sports to fish that use ice to protect themselves from predators during spawning season. It also makes the shoreline more susceptible to erosion, increasing potential damage to coastal infrastructure.

title: Jan Marsalek, from Wirecard fraudster to spy for Russia
summary: The trail of Jan Marsalek, one of the former directors of the German online payment company that went bankrupt after balance sheet manipulation, was lost in June 2020. Since then, media reports have claimed that he is working for Russian intelligence services.

title: For International Women's Day, Paris's Musée d'Orsay teams up with a feminist collective for passionate debates
summary: On March 8, the Paris museum posted on its website four videos made with the Puissance des femmes collective, using works from its collections.

title: OpenAI reinstates CEO Sam Altman to board after investigation
summary: OpenAI said it has 'full confidence' in Altman and tried to show investors and customers that it is moving past the internal conflicts that nearly destroyed it last year and made global headlines.

title: Macron says he wants abortion added to EU rights charter
summary: France on Friday officially inscribed the guaranteed access to abortion in its Constitution after Parliament voted in favor of the amendment.

title: Macron's call for 'unwavering' support for Kyiv risks isolating him on French political scene
summary: France's president called a meeting of party leaders to clarify positions, following his remarks on allied troops in Ukraine. Far from backing down, he tried to justify his position, drawing criticism from the opposition.

title: Erdogan says March local elections will be his 'last'
summary: Recep Tayyip Erdogan hinted that the upcoming local elections would be his last vote. He was re-elected for a five-year term in May 2023.

title: France's CAC 40 companies register billions of euros in profits and dividends in record year
summary: France's largest corporations generated profits of €153.6 billion last year. Dividends, at €67.8 billion, and share buybacks, at €30.1 billion, reached unprecedented highs.

title: Israel-Hamas ceasefire talks are stalling as Ramadan approaches
summary: Despite efforts from Egyptian and Qatari mediators, and US pressure on Israel, the prospect of an end to the fighting before Ramadan has become increasingly unlikely.

title: Abortion rights: A history of France's legal battle
summary: As France officially inscribed the guaranteed access to abortion in its constitution on Friday, Le Monde takes a look at how abortion rights have evolved since the landmark Veil Law in 1975.

title: Former PM blasts 'insidious sexism' in French politics
summary: Borne, 62, was the second woman to serve as prime minister after Edith Cresson in the 1990s.

title: Trump's daughter-in-law elected to Republican Party leadership role
summary: Lara Trump was elected to be the co-chair of the Republican National Committee, securing even more Trump allies in positions of power ahead of this year's presidential election.

title: US explores 'temporary pier' for Gaza aid delivery, without altering its support for Israel
summary: Joe Biden would like to set up an 'emergency mission' in order to increase the amount of humanitarian aid. The vague initiative would take many weeks to implement.

title: A privacy scandal in Italy unnerves country's politicians
summary: A Guardia di Finanza officer is said to have collected confidential information about hundreds of people, some of them politicians close to Giorgia Meloni.

title: US: Program that allows 30,000 migrants from 4 countries on humanitarian grounds each month upheld by judge
summary: The key piece of President Biden's immigration policy allows a limited number of migrants from four countries to enter the US on humanitarian grounds.

title: African Initiative, the new bridgehead for Russian propaganda in Africa
summary: Since the death of Wagner's leader Yevgeny Prigozhin and the dismantling of his mercenary group, a new structure has been created in Moscow, headed by Viktor Lukovenko, a former Wagner member.

title: In Senegal, all the candidates are ready to campaign for the presidential election except one, behind bars
summary: The election date has been set for March 24. Nineteen people are running, but Bassirou Diomaye Faye, one of the main candidates, is in prison.

title: In Argentina, feminists and LGBT groups challenge Javier Milei
summary: Activists fear a threat to abortion rights, described by the Argentine president as 'aggravated murder.'

title: Akira Toriyama, the self-taught manga creator who just wanted to draw what he liked
summary: The author of "Dr. Slump" and "Dragon Ball," an icon of the manga industry, has died aged 68. He leaves behind a body of work as inventive as it was frustrating.

title: US senators avoid a partial shutdown
summary: The lawmakers staved off the shutdown with a deal allowing the departments or agencies dealing with agriculture, commerce, justice, science, environment, housing, and transport to function until the end of the fiscal year, on September 30.

title: Expanding Israeli settlements a 'war crime', according to the UN
summary: France's foreign ministry also said it 'strongly condemns' the settlement plan and called on the Israeli government to 'immediately reverse this decision' to build another 3,476 settler homes in the West Bank colonies.

title: Donald Trump's ineligibility: 'US Supreme Court justices tried to avoid the trap of partisan interference'
summary: On March 4, the US Supreme Court unanimously rejected a Colorado decision declaring the former president ineligible over his role in the assault on the Capitol on January 6, 2021. Good news for Donald Trump, less so for democracy, writes lawyer Laurent Cohen-Tanugi in an op-ed for 'Le Monde.'

title: Philosopher Camille Froidevaux-Metterie: 'The female body is historically the ultimate site of male domination'
summary: Do women finally own their bodies? Despite the progress made over the last 10 years, including the recent addition of the right to have an abortion in the Constitution, philosopher Camille Froidevaux-Metterie points out that the systems of control over the female body persist.

title: East Jerusalem prepares for a Ramadan unlike others
summary: Al-Aqsa, Islam's third holiest site, is gearing up for a special religious holiday amid the war in Gaza, the provocations of Hamas, and the messianic aims of Jewish supremacists.

title: After Istanbul visit, Zelensky is counting on Turkey's support
summary: On March 8, the Ukrainian president met with his Turkish counterpart, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who is once again trying to mediate between Kyiv and Moscow.

title: 'The Regime': Kate Winslet plays paranoid autocrat in dystopia created by 'Succession' alumnus
summary: In Will Tracy's bold but overly complex political fiction, the brilliant British actress takes on the role of a neurotic, unpopular chancellor.

title: Navalny's parents thank Russian crowds for paying respects
summary: Thousands of mourners were present for the opposition leader's funeral and have continued to bring flowers to his grave.

title: UK's David Cameron opposes sending troops to Ukraine, even for training
summary: Cameron said training missions are best carried out abroad, as British troops have done so far.

title: Macron's coalition launches European election campaign focusing on Ukraine
summary: Top members of Macron's Renaissance party and its allies are holding a rally in Lille to launch their campaign, which will be led by MEP Valérie Hayer. The president plans not to get involved until a later stage.

title: Portugal elections: 'The populist Chega party could emerge as a key player'
summary: As Portuguese voters head to the polls on March 10 to elect their new government, researchers Jorge Gomes da Costa and Jean Mercereau analyze how André Ventura's far-right party is becoming the country's third-biggest party.

title: Pakistan: Asif Ali Zardari voted president for second time
summary: The widower of Pakistan's slain prime minister Benazir Bhutto returns to the role he held between 2008 and 2013.
